This information must then be sent by SMS to another contact (who requested the information) from the “Contacts Content Provider”. Question 2: create a main activity to display a GUI and also a SMSReceiver that extends the BroadCastReceiver.In this app you create a spam checker and a method to transfer your SMS to file storage. Create a class named “SMSReceiver” that will receive a SMS. Use the DDMS to send SMSs to your emulator.
To send a contacts name and phone number to another contact start typing the contacts name in the send text box, you will be prompted with suggestions based on your input so once you see the contact that you wish to send select it from the suggestions. Next, start typing the name of the contact you wish to send the details to in the to text box and select the required contact from the suggestions. The send sms button should now be enabled, click it to send the details.
Use this app to check your sms for spam, the application will look for the words win or competition and if it finds either of these words a warning will display. Messages that do not contain any spam can be saved to a file. To check a message for spam click the message or open the options menu and click perform spam check
